lines.text: Oh, honey, don't think about him. They tell me he plays women just like he plays poker. Riffle, shuffle, fast cut, big deal, the sky's the limit; and then all of a sudden you're lying there in the discard.
You got a new lease on life, gents, so don't break it by moving!
The name's Illinois Grey - gambler. Not very moral, not very brave. But I don't welsh and I don't squeal. I'm my own law and my own man. I don't hold myself above you, or you me.
Stay back, mister!
Oh, don't worry, miss. I've got respect for ladies - especially those with revolvers.
[first lines]
[Slidell has just posted a sign announcing a 25-cent fee for viewing the dead Dalton Boys]
Ah, good morning, Mr. Parsh.
Good morning.
Oh, Mr. Parsh, just a moment, please. Twenty-five cents, sir.
Identification is my object, Mr. Slidell, not amusement.
You're a private detective, sir, not a lawman with the privileges of a public servant. Twenty-five cents, please, sir.
[Parsh throws a quarter into the dust a Slidell's feet]

Well, you never got that close to 'em when they was alive, did you, Mr. Detective. How long did you hound those poor creatures, Mr. Parsh? Somethin' like five years, wasn't it? It sure is too bad you couldn't have been in on the kill. You'da got a real pleasure out of seein' 'em out there in the dust, kickin' and a-screamin'.
Holly, I'm scared!
I've been on the run for the past seven years and I'm still not over being scared. I guess if I wasn't scared, I'd be tired.
I don't like felling scared, Holly.
You'll get used to it. The first time's always the worst.
All right, wrangler, up with those hands unless you want a buttonhole on the back of that vest.
All these months I've been dreaming of California - it got so I could even smell the orange blossoms currying a horse.
You can't expect jackpots in every game, honey.
And you can't expect to be a lady, either! You might as well face up to it - you're a Dalton!
